What's New with Woo
Big things are happening for the developer community at Woo, and even more is on the way.
From revamped docs to better store experiences and platform modernizations, we're committed to building a collaborative, future-oriented ecosystem. Get insights into our roadmap for the rest of 2024 - and beyond - from Beau Lebens, our Head of Engineering.
See what's in store

New in our Marketplace

Enable simple, certified web3
Help clients mint and sell NFTs on their store using Verisart.

With this one-stop web3 solution, merchants can create certificates of authenticity, bundle physical and digital products, and offer flexible wallet and minting options - no crypto needed.
Get started with Verisart
Get started with Verisart

Unlock their data potential
Give clients an effortless way to dive into their data with PayHelm.
Connect all data sources in one place and uncover insights into sales, marketing, and customers - and help clients grow profits with a deeper understanding of their stores.
Enable useful analytics
Enable useful analytics

New in WooCommerce 9.1
  • Build in private with the help of coming soon mode, now officially enabled. Whether it's a new store or an installation on an existing site, display a "coming soon" landing page and reassure clients that their stores are ready to launch.
  • Helpful styling changes have been added to the checkout blocks, including spacing improvements on desktop and mobile, adjustments to input fields, and a more visible "Return to cart" link.
  • The entire shop accounts section received an accessibility upgrade to make sure alerts and error messages are announced by screen readers.

Bite-sized updates
  • Streamline product reviews with smart Klaviyo Reviews for WooCommerce. Built right into the Klaviyo platform, it lets clients easily collect product reviews and gather rich customer data.
  • To ensure security, performance, and scalability within WooCommerce, we've implemented stricter version requirements on certain extensions. Read our advisory for the latest updates.
  • As of July 30, the current stable tag has been applied to WooCommerce 9.1.4.

Looking for help building your dream store?
Find a WooExpert

Looking for help building your dream store?
Find a WooExpert

Run your store from anywhere
